solution_line_template: First find how long the first trail takes to hike: {trail_one_distance} miles / {trail_one_speed} miles/hour = <<{trail_one_distance}/{trail_one_speed}={trail_one_time}>>{trail_one_time} hours

Then find how long James spends hiking the second trail: {trail_two_distance} miles / {trail_two_speed} miles/hour = <<{trail_two_distance}/{trail_two_speed}={trail_two_hiking_time}>>{trail_two_hiking_time} hours

Then add the {break_time} hour break James has to take on the second trail: {trail_two_hiking_time} hours + {break_time} hour = <<{trail_two_hiking_time}+{break_time}={trail_two_total_time}>>{trail_two_total_time} hours

Then subtract the time for the first trail from the time for the second trail to find the difference: {trail_two_total_time} hours - {trail_one_time} hours = <<{trail_two_total_time}-{trail_one_time}={time_difference}>>{time_difference} hour
